poem:
Title: "In the Halls of Fuel and Finance"

The iron promise,
a drizzle of meagre victory,
upon the thirsting many.
Caskets of barrelled wealth
steal away our shared sun-days,
while silver noises applaud,
in the cold parliament of stone.
Do not be fooled,
the cuts of inequity,
Sculpt their horrid masterpiece,
upon the common clay.

So much depends
upon a meagre saving,
behind the smoke 
of power's play.
